column1: # This is a tab delimited spreadsheet (TSV) for all Heimdall messages.
# The message levels are best practice (b), info (i), warning (w), error (e), and critical (c).

column3: description
The ‘exp’ attribute ‘{exp_value}’ in the resources file ‘{resource_path}’ is hard coded. This is less portable and more fragile. Consider using a variable instead.
EntryModule link does not exist: ‘{entry_module}’
EntryModule is not a link: ‘{entry_module}’
Could not find an experiment for path: '{path}'. A valid experiment folder contains an 'EntryModule' link.
The required EntryModule flow.xml file does not exist: ‘{flow_xml}’
The required EntryModule flow.xml file failed to parse as XML: ‘{flow_xml}’
All suites require the folders: ‘listings’, ‘sequencing’, ‘stats’, and ‘logs’. This suite is missing: {folders}

column2: Hard coded path in config file
column3: The path ‘{bad_path}’ defined in ‘{config_path}’ is absolute and does not start with a variable like ‘${{SEQ_EXP_HOME}}’. This is a less portable and more fragile way to configure an experiment.
The ‘exp’ attribute ‘{exp_value}’ in the resources file ‘{resource_path}’ is not a path to a folder that exists.
The resource XML ‘{resource_path}’ uses variables that are not defined in any resource files like ‘resources/resources.def’. Variables: {variable_names}
Failed to parse XML: ‘{xml}’
Invalid task name ‘{task_name}’ at path '{task_path}’
Soft links were found with targets that do not exist:\n{broken_links}
The flow XML children for module ‘{module_name}’ are defined in more than one flow XML:\n{flow_xmls}
The executable ‘nodelogger’ was given a bad signal ‘{bad_signal}’ for its ‘-s’ argument. Line {line_number} in: ‘{task_path}’
The task ‘{task_path}’ has no resource file at ‘{resource_path}’. This is required for the ‘{context}’ context.

column2: Missing curly brackets in resource xml
column3: Variables in resource XMLs must use curly brackets like ‘${{ABC}}’ not ‘$ABC’. The {search} was found in file: ‘{file_path}’

column2: Unbalanced curly brackets in resource xml
column3: Found an uneven number of curly brackets ‘{attribute_value}’ in a resource file: ‘{file_path}’

The maestro experiment is found in the home folder ‘{real_home}’ but core maestro files are soft links to other user homes. This may be unstable and cannot be installed operationally. Links:\n{bad_links}
The task ‘{task_path}’ has no resource file at ‘{resource_path}’. Create a resource file to avoid using unknown defaults.
The loop ‘{node_path}’ has no resource file at ‘{resource_path}’. Create a resource file to avoid using unknown defaults.
The paths site1 and site2 are no longer available after the upgrades in early 2020. The {search} was found in file: ‘{file_path}’
The paths hall1 and hall2 are no longer available after the upgrades in early 2020. The {search} was found in file: ‘{file_path}’

The maestro experiment is found in the home folder ‘{real_home}’ but core maestro files are soft links to other user homes. This may be unstable and cannot be installed operationally. Links:\n{bad_links}

column2: Hard coded path in config file
column3: The path ‘{bad_path}’ defined in ‘{config_path}’ is absolute and does not start with a variable like ‘${{SEQ_EXP_HOME}}’. This is a less portable and more fragile way to configure an experiment.
The SupportInfo attribute in the XML ‘{xml_path}’ is ‘{char_count}’ but it should be shorter. The recommended maximum is {max_chars}. characters.
The SupportInfo attribute in the XML ‘{xml_path}’ should contain a URL. This is the recommended way to provide detailed support status info and troubleshooting steps.
The SupportInfo attribute in the XML ‘{xml_path}’ should start with a value like ‘Full Support’. Recommended start strings: {substrings}

column2: No support status in operational experiment
column3: There is no SupportInfo attribute in the XML ‘{xml_path}’ or the XML does not exist. This is required for operational experiments.
The XML ‘{xml_path}’ has more than one SupportInfo element.
The resource variable ‘{maybe_typo}’ is defined but the standard variable name ‘{expected}’ is not. Did you mean that instead?

column2: Bad queue value for resource variable
column3: The value ‘{value}’ for the resource variable ‘{name}’ is not a queue available in qstat. Queues: {queues}
The experiment seems to have the ‘{context}’ context but it was not found in the {exp_count} experiments in the overview XML: {xml_path}
The experiment seems to have the ‘{context}’ context but it was found in the {exp_count} experiments in the ‘{xml_context}’ context overview XML: {xml_path}

column2: Dissemination state does not match context
column3: The experiment seems to have the ‘{context}’ context but variables in ‘{cfg_path}’ do not match what is expected: {unexpected}
The variables {variables} belong only in ‘experiment.cfg’ files but were found in: ‘{cfg_path}’
These files or folders are deprecated and should be deleted: {deprecated}
Experiments with the ‘{context}’ context can only have soft link folders in their ‘hub’ folder. Bad: {bad}
The hub folder links ‘{folder1}’ and ‘{folder2}’ are expected to have similar targets. Instead they are very different:\n{target1}\n{target2}
The module folder ‘{folder_name}’ differs from the module name ‘{attribute_name}’ in the flow XML ‘{xml_path}’. This can help organize a project, but it may also be confusing.
The maestro folder ‘{folder}’ should only contain maestro files like tsk, cfg, xml. These files were found: {filenames}
